## Classes

### `deployment_signature`

A description of what this class does

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include deployment_signature
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `deployment_signature` class.

##### `signature_location`

Data type: `String`

Where on disk the signatures should be stored

Default value: `'TODO'`

##### `signing_secret`

Data type: `Sensitive[String]`

Signing secret is used to actually *sign* the signature. The source of the signature needs to have the same value
as the destination for the signature to be verified. This means that even if a user was to get access to run the signature cration
task, they would also need to know the value of this secret for the signatures that it generates to be valid

Default value: `Sensitive('puppetlabs')`

##### `puppet_user`

Data type: `String`

The user that should own sugnatures, this should be the same user that the puppetserver runs as

Default value: `'pe-puppet'`

##### `puppet_group`

Data type: `String`

The group that should own sugnatures, this should be the same group that the puppetserver runs as

Default value: `'pe-puppet'`

## Tasks

### `register`

Registers a signature in advance of code being deployed

**Supports noop?** false

#### Parameters

##### `commit_hash`

Data type: `String[40,40]`

The git SHA of the commit that you want to create a signature for

##### `data`

Data type: `String[1]`
